text: Hi. I just ecnountered the same problem as Chris. Are there any news on when there will be an update to the API. Getting the JSON with all the form information, modifying it and then overwriting all form data via PUT doesn't seem like a handy solution to me.

<@UFBNA9K9A>
Have you had the time to check on the timeline? :slightly_smiling_face:

Possible bug with the V3 Events API

 It seems to no longer return form events. Specifically,
`<https://api.hubapi.com/events/v3/events?occuredAfter=2020-11-01T00%3A00%3A00.000Z&objectId=[contact> ID]&objectType=contact&hapikey=[api key]`
returns all events after 11/1, but
`<https://api.hubapi.com/events/v3/events?eventType=e_submitted_form&occuredAfter=2020-11-01T00%3A00%3A00.000Z&objectId=>[contact ID]&objectType=contact&hapikey=[api key]`
returns a blank result with a 200 status, even thought that contact record has a form submission on 11/3
Worth noting that parsing the all events all does not show any form submissions either, but shows email events and session details

Hey <@UGHUY6AJ0> the team wasn’t willing to commit to a timeline but they did let me know the main blocker is around quote validation. A lot of this is handled by the front end today but will need to be handled by the API itself now. Usually once a team identifies a blocker that means they aren’t too far away but I know they also have some general infrastructure work to do before exposing writing via the API
Okey, thanks for checking with the team! :smiley: I appreciate it!
Hey <@UGFURDXD4> That’s for the heads up, I’ve passed this along to the team that owns that APi to look at

You _could_ use a <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/automation/custom-workflow-actions-beta|custom workflow action> and use the associations API to get whatever information you need and stamp it to the record going through workflow to use it in personalization tokens.  If you have access to the CMS enteprise, the endpoint it calls could be a serverless function. Otherwise you might use your own app or Google Cloud Function/AWS Lambda
<@UGFURDXD4> DO you have an example contact we could look? Feel free to direct message me to keep the ids private
Is there a channel on here about custom objects? Need to know if I'm allowed to delete and recreate an object. Currently throwing an 'OBJECT_ALREADY_EXISTS' error after I deleted the object.

<@UMGLMQLA0> Strange, can you post a message on <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/bd-p/integrations> ? Explain your isssue, post your code and i will look for a solution during my day

Hi i saw an integration that zapier with HubSpot, basically every time there is an update a HubSpot zapier contact can get that event, my question is is there any callback or something similar? that I can use to receive those events
Webhook ?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>
<@U01E7G1668L> i think it’s what you are looking for
<@U01DF3PNCKA> Yes, I know how webhooks work, but is this how zapier works? Isn't there a way to do this with a callback?
What do you expect really in your project ?
Because webhook are http callback, so if it’s not what you want, what do you expect , what is the meaning of « callback » for you ?
Appreciate it thanks!
I've posted the issue here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Issue-with-recreating-custom-object-API-after-previous-deletion/td-p/384101>
